content.question: The function <math alttext="y equals f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> satisfies the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x, equals 2 x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="f of 0 equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 plus e to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>
<math alttext="5 e to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5 e to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>5</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

topic.text: 7.6: Finding General Solutions Using Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
